title: Notifications
alias: message banner, toast, snackbar, alert, info, error, warning, success

title: Circle toggle group expert default example
Expert: Use full row for Expandable area
Add custom form elements to the table
Example of setting min and max values
Custom error state matching Formfield Example
File uploader with max number of files example
Menu item with large indentation and button icons
Modal with content and actions example
Disabled as part of disabled form example
Progress Indicator multi manual step completion example
Progress Indicator non linear step completion example
Progress Indicator reactive form with separate form per step
Progress Indicator reactive form with single form example
Radio button group label size Example
Small stage expert narrow content example
Advanced example for sorting, filtering and pagination

name: NxExpansionPanelDescriptionDirective
title: This directive is to be used inside of the NxExpansionPanelHeader component.

name: NxExpansionPanelTitleDirective
title: This directive is to be used inside of the NxExpansionPanelHeader component.

name: NxContextMenuContentDirective
title: Context menu content that will be rendered lazily once the menu is opened.

name: NxContextMenuTriggerDirective
title:
This directive is intended to be used in conjunction with an nx-context-menu tag.
It is responsible for toggling the display of the provided context menu instance.

name: NxDatefieldDirective
title: Directive used to provide date processing functionality to an input.

name: NxDatepickerToggleIconComponent
title: Can be used to override the icon of a `nxDatepickerToggle`.

name: NxFormfieldLabelDirective
title: A directive for passing more complex custom label content.

name: NxHeaderRowDirective
title: This directive defines a header row within the `<nx-header>` component.

name: NxHeaderBrandDirective
title: This directive defines the header brand section within the `<nx-header>` component.

name: NxHeaderActionsDirective
title: This directive defines the header actions section within the `<nx-header>` component.

name: NxHeaderNavigationItemDirective
title: This directive defines a header navigation item within the `<nx-header-navigation>`.

name: NxHeaderAppTitleDirective
title: This directive defines the application title within the `<nx-header>` component.

name: NxIbanMaskDirective
title: To use the `NxIbanMaskDirective`, you have to install the **peer dependency** `iban.js`.

name: NxMenuButtonIconDirective
title: Icon that can be added to a [nxButton].

name: NxMenuItemDirective
title: This is a menu item is used to structure content whithin a menu.

name: NxMenuLinkDirective
title:
This is a menu link.
It adds styling to a link and is usually used within a [nxMenuItem].

name: NxModalCloseDirective
title: Button that will close the current modal.

name: NxModalActionsDirective
title: Container for the action buttons in a modal. Has a fixed position at the bottom of the modal on scroll.

name: NxModalContentDirective
title: Scrollable container for the content of a modal.

name: NxNumberStepperPrefixDirective
title: Directive used to pass a suffix to the number stepper.

name: NxNumberStepperSuffixDirective
title: Directive used to pass a suffix to the number stepper.

name: NxPopoverContentDirective
title:
Popover content that will be rendered lazily
after the popover is opened for the first time.

name: NxSmallStageImageBottomDirective
title: A directive for passing the bottom image into small stage component.

name: NxSmallStageImageEndDirective
title: A directive for passing the end image into small stage component.

name: NxSmallStageHeaderDirective
title: A directive for passing contents to small stage header.

name: NxSmallStageImageDirective
title: This is an image that can be placed into the small stage component.

name: NxSmallStageImageStartDirective
title: A directive for passing the start image into small stage component.

name: NxExpandableTableDirective
title:
The nxExpandableTable adds row expansion functionality to the nxTable.
It provides the logic to expand/collapse all expandable rows simultanously.

name: NxHeaderCellDirective
title: This is a table header cell.

name: NxTabContentDirective
title: Decorates the `ng-template` tags and reads out the template from it.

name: NxTooltipDirective
title: Directive that attaches a tooltip to the host element.

name: NxTreeNodeDefDirective
title: Wrapper for the CdkTree node definition with custom design styles.

name: NxTreeNodeOutletDirective
title:
Outlet for nested CdkNode. Put `[nxTreeNodeOutlet]` on a tag to place children dataNodes
inside the outlet.

name: NxTreeNodePaddingDirective
title:
Indent for the children tree dataNodes.
This directive will add left-padding to the node to show hierarchy.

name: NxTreeNodeToggleDirective
title: Wrapper for the CdkTree's toggle with custom design styles.

name: NxContextMenuItemComponent
title:
This directive is intended to be used inside an nx-context-menu tag.
It exists mostly to set the role attribute, disabled state and styling.

name: NxContextMenuItemWrapComponent
title: This directive is need when [nx-context-menu-item] is not directly under [nx-context-menu].

name: NxDatepickerComponent
title: Component responsible for managing the datepicker popup/dialog.

name: NxFileUploaderItemSize
title: Shows a file size in Megabyte (MB) or an alternative label while the file is uploading.

name: NxFileUploaderItemStatus
title: Shows the current uploading status of a file.

name: NxHeaderComponent
title: The `<nx-header>` component is the main application header.

name: NxHeaderNavigationComponent
title: This component defines the header navigation section within the `<nx-header>` component.

name: NxHeaderLinkComponent
title: This component defines a header link within the `<nx-header>` component.

name: NxLicencePlateEuroPrefixComponent
title: Euro country prefix for the licence plate input.

name: NxLicencePlateSeasonSuffixComponent
title: Suffix for seasonal licence plate inputs.

name: NxLinkComponent
title:
`Input('nxStyle') classNames` sets the style of the link, thereby altering the visual appearance.
You can use any combination of 'black', 'icon-right', 'icon-only', 'negative' or 'text'.

name: NxMenuComponent
title:
This components is a collapsible menu for usage on smaller devices.

Can contain any content, but usually [nxMenuLink], [nxMenuGroup] and [nxAction].

name: NxNumberStepperComponent
title:
`Input('nxSize') classNames` defines the size of the number stepper.

Values: `'big' | 'normal'`.

Default: `'normal'`.

name: NxOverlayContainerComponent
title: Internal component that wraps user-provided overlay content.

name: NxExpandableTableCellComponent
title:
This is an expandable table cell.
Only works in conjunction with the `[nxExpandableTableRow]` component.

name: NxExpandableTableRowComponent
title:
This is an expandable table row.
It can collapse its height to hide the content.
Requires the table cells to have the `[nxExpandableTableCell]` component.

name: NxToggleButtonComponent
title:
This toggle button can be clicked and toggles expandable elements.

E.g. it can toggle a expandable table row or anything else that implements the `NxExpandable` interface.

name: NxTableComponent
title:
This is a table.
The table supports a `zebra` and a `condensed` mode.

name: NxTreeNodeComponent
title: Wrapper for the CdkTree node with custom design styles.

name: NxTreeComponent
title: Wrapper for the CdkTree with custom design styles and keyboard nav mechanics.

name: NxConfigurationService
title:
Service for switching values of the defaultOptions injection tokens at runtime.
WARNING: This service should not be used in actual applications!
It is only meant to showcase different options for documentation purposes.

name: NxMessageToastService
title: A service for dispatching and displaying toast messages.

name: NxDialogService
title: Service to open Material Design modal modals.

name: NxViewportService
title: Service subscribing to window resize events and providing breakpoint matching functions.

name: SelectableCardDefaultOptions
title:
Represents the default options for the selectable card.
It can be configured using the `NX_SELECTABLE_CARD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token.

name: CircleToggleGroupDefaultOptions
title:
Represents the default options for the circle toggle group.
It can be configured using the `CIRCLE_TOGGLE_GROUP_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token.

name: NxDropdownOption
title:
An option of the dropdown.
Contains a value and an optional label.
If no label is specified, the value will be displayed instead.

name: NxDynamicTableColumnDefinition
title: Dynamic table column definition consisting of key, title and type properties.

name: FormfieldDefaultOptions
title:
Represents the default options for the form field that can be configured
using the `FORMFIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token.

name: NxDialogPosition
title: Possible overrides for a modal's position.

name: IPaginationTexts
title:
Interface for providing custom labels in a simple pagination.
With an implementation you can localize your pagination with the NX_PAGINATION_TEXTS injection token.

name: SmallStageDefaultOptions
title:
Represents the default options for the small stage.
It can be configured using the `NX_SMALL_STAGE_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token.

name: NxTooltipDefaultOptions
title: Default `nxTooltip` options that can be overridden.

name: NxTreeNode
title: This interface defines a single node of the trees data structure.

name: LABEL_SIZE_TYPE
title: Options for sizing of the label.

name: NxCircleToggleGroupAppearance
title: Appearance options for the circle toggle group component.

name: NxScrollStrategy
title: Scroll strategy default presets for overlay-based components.

name: NxScrollStrategyOptions
title: Scroll strategy default preset options for overlay-based components.

name: NxCopytextType
title: A type that specifies the font size of a copytext.

name: NxDataDisplayOrientation
title:
Layout orientation of the NxDataDisplayComponent.

- 'vertical': label and value are vertically stacked.
- 'horizontal': label and value are on the same line.
- 'horizontal-columns': label and value are on the same line in a fixed position.

name: FloatLabelType
title: Type for the available floatLabel values.

name: AppearanceType
title: Type for the appearance of the formfield.

name: ColSelfAlignment
title: Type for the available alignment values of a column inside the flexible container.

name: ColOrder
title: Type for the available values for setting the order of a column within a row.

name: CONTEXT
title: The contextual type of a message.

name: NxMessageToastContext
title: The contextual type of a message.

name: NxModalRole
title: Valid ARIA roles for a modal element.

name: SIZES
title: Type to determine the minimal width of a word.

name: NxOverlayRole
title: The ARIA role of the overlay.

name: PositionType
title: Type for the available position values.

name: Appearance
title: Type for the appearance of the sidepanel.

name: NxSmallStageAppearance
title: Appearance options for the small stage component.

name: SpinnerSize
title: Options for sizing of the spinner.

name: POSITION
title: Options for placement of the label

name: LABEL_SIZE
title: Options for sizing of the label

name: NxAutocompleteSelectedEvent
title: Event object that is emitted when an autocomplete option is selected.

name: ErrorDefaultOptions
title:
Represents the default options for the error notification that can be configured
using the `ERROR_DEFAULT_OPTIONS` injection token.

name: NxDateAdapter
title: Base class for all adapter implementations

name: NxDateValidators
title: Provides a set of date validators that can be used by form controls.

name: NxDatepickerInputEvent
title:
An event used for datepicker input and change events. We don't always have access to a native
input or change event because the event may have been triggered by the user clicking on the
calendar popup. For consistency, we always use NxDatepickerInputEvent instead.

name: NxDropdownSelectChange
title: Change event object that is emitted when the select value has changed.

name: NxFileUploaderIntl
title: File uploader data that requires internationalization.

name: FileItem
title: Class used to keep track of the current states of the file.

name: NxFileUploaderValidators
title:
Provides a set of file uploader validators that can be used by form controls.

Currently `maxFileSize` and `fileType` are available.

name: NxMessageToastConfig
title: Configuration used when opening a message toast.

name: NxModalConfig
title: Configuration for opening a modal  with the NxDialogService.

name: NxModalRef
title: Reference to a modal opened via the NxDialogService.

name: NxOverlayConfig
title: Configuration for opening a overlay  with the NxDialogService.

name: NxOverlayRef
title: Reference to a overlay opened via the NxDialogService.

name: NxTriggerButton
title:
Interface for any kind of button that should be active while
an overlay is open.

name: NxRadioChange
title: The change event object emitted by the radio group and radio button.

name: MiscTemplateMigration
title:
Migration that walks through every template and reports if there are
instances of outdated Angular CDK API that can't be migrated automatically.

TODO: make it reusable across major versions, e.g. with a custom data object
similar to the CDK UpgradeData.

name: SchematicTestSetup
title:
Helper for setting up everything needed for the schematic tests.
It creates things like the TempScopedNodeJsSyncHost and exposes everything and
registers the beforeEach and afterEach hooks for jasmine.

It also gives you access to functions:
+ writeFile: makes it possibble to write to the tempFileSystemHost and also updates the hostTree
+ syncTreeToFileSystem: syncs the whole app tree to the disk
+ runMigration: call to run the schematic name you specified in the constructor

name: NxTreeFlatDataSource
title:
Data source for flat tree.
The data source need to handle expansion/collapsion of the tree node and change the data feed
to `NxTree`.
The nested tree nodes of type `T extends NxTreeNode` are flattened through `NxTreeFlattener`, and converted
to type `F extends NxFlatTreeNode` for `NxTree` to consume.

name: NxFlatTreeControl
title: Flat tree control, allows to expand/collapse a subtree recursively for flattened tree.

name: ErrorStateMatcher
title: Provider that defines when form controls have an error.
Getting started
content:
Getting started

With ng-aquila we are providing an Angular powered user interface (UI) library.

Prerequisite

You should have Node.js and the Angular CLI installed.

Automatic setup with ng add

  1. Create your project with Angular CLI:

    npm install -g @angular/cli
ng new my-allianz-project

  2. Add ng-aquila:

    ng add @aposin/ng-aquila

    Add the background color of the default theme to your styles file:

    body {
    background: #0f2a3d;
}

Congratulations you're done

Now you can include components and start building your application.

Manual setup

You can also install ng-aquila manually.

  1. Create your project with Angular CLI:

    npm install -g @angular/cli
ng new my-allianz-project

  2. Install ng-aquila and dependencies

    cd my-allianz-project
npm install @aposin/ng-aquila
npm install @angular/cdk

    Depending on your needs, you may also install

    • iban.js if you want to use the iban mask (npm install iban)

    • moment.js if you want to use it as the adapter for the datefield (npm install moment)

    You can check the supported versions of peer dependencies here.

  3. Add base styles

    Add the styles to the angular.json. You need the base styles ('normalize.css') and a theme file ('aposin.css' or 'expert.css'):

    "architect": {
  "build": {
    "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
    "options": {
      // ...
      "styles": [
        // ...
        "node_modules/@aposin/ng-aquila/css/normalize.css",
        "node_modules/@aposin/ng-aquila/themes/aposin.css"
      ]
    }
  }
}

    Add the background color of the default theme to your styles file:

    body {
    background: #0f2a3d;
}

  4. Add NxExpertModule (optional)

    In an expert/b2b application you also need the NxExpertModule to your app.module.ts. More information can be found on the documentation page about the expert module.

    // ...
import { NxExpertModule } from '@aposin/ng-aquila/config';

@NgModule({
    imports: [
        // ...
        NxExpertModule,
    ],
    // ...
})
export class AppModule {}

Device and Browser Support

We fully support the following browsers:

  • Chrome: latest
  • Firefox: latest and extended support release (ESR)
  • MS Edge: 2 most recent major versions
  • Safari: 2 most recent major versions

We do not support IE11 since version 13 and recommend to use modern browsers instead.

Contributing

We do not support external contributions yet, but hope we can in future.

title: Releases und updating
content:
Releases und updating

Release plan

Our release strategy is naturally synchronized with Angular's. The main reason for this is to minimize the frequency of breaking changes. The Angular team releases a major version every six months, whenever we update to this version we expect breaking changes. Thus, we will release any breaking change within Angular NDBX along with the major release of Angular. Consequently, you can expect breaking changes (major update) within ng-aquila about every six months.

As the Angular team now provides release dates down to a week, we are able to prepare in advance and provide more specific release terms. We will release a major version during a 6-week period after a major Angular release. Any delays will be communicated on this page.

We trigger minor or bug fix releases if they provide a meaningful delivery (fix or feature). This is usually decided in our weekly refinement meeting.

Date Angular version ng-aquila version LTS end
September 2021 12 12 November 2022
December 2021 13 13 May 2023
November 2022 14 14 December 2023
December 2022 15 15 January 2024

Angular NDBX versions 11 and older are no longer supported.

During Long-Term Support (LTS) only critical fixes and security patches will be released. LTS of a major version starts as soon as the successor is released. If your applications are running of the LTS, you may (at your own discretion) fork your respective version and support it within your organization.

Updating to version 14

With v14, we are upgrading to Angular 14. In most cases the following command should do the Angular update for you:

ng update @angular/cli @angular/core

Then it should be easy to update Aquila with the following command:

ng update @aposin/ng-aquila --force

Breaking Changes

  • added readonly keyword to public properties which are not meant to be changed.

We are not providing automatic updates for these breaking changes.

Updating to version 13

With v13, we are upgrading to Angular 13. In most cases the following command should do the Angular update for you:

ng update @angular/cli @angular/core

Then it should be easy to update Aquila with the following command:

ng update @aposin/ng-aquila --force

Important:

  • With this release we are dropping support of Internet Explorer and removing all the code that was meant to support IE-only functionality and fix its issues. Make sure your project doesn't need IE support before migrating to v13. In case you still need to support IE, consider using LTS v12.
  • Following Angular development, the library is now distributed in ivy partial compilation mode.

Breaking Changes

  • footer: spacing - to restore previous values, override the following new variables:
    • footer-padding-top: 24px (retail only)
    • footer-padding-bottom: 72px
    • footer-mobile-padding-top: 40px (retail only)
    • footer-mobile-padding-bottom: 72px

We are not providing automatic updates for these breaking changes.

Updating to version 12

With v12, we are upgrading to Angular 12. To update your Angular installation please check the respective update guide. In most cases the following command should do the update:

ng update @angular/cli @angular/core

Things to consider for the Angular version 12 update:

  • Angular12 generates new applications in strict mode by default. This introduces much more strict type-checking within templates, see more details here. It also enables Typescript strict mode that enforces much stricter type-checking in code, as well.
  • TypeScript is updated to version 4.2.

It should be easy to update with the following command:

ng update @aposin/ng-aquila --force

Important: The visual padding of the Accordion component changes with this update in accordance with the design guidelines. We are not providing an automatic update for this breaking change.

Updating to version 11

Breaking Changes

With v11 there are some breaking changes:

  • Removal of outer margins of components

    When ng-aquila was started, the first components were implemented with default outer margins. But since the number of projects using ng-aquila is growing, this is not suitable anymore for a lot of use cases and projects. This is why we decided to remove them with v11.

    Please be aware that this change might affect the styling and layout of your application and it should be checked for visual differences.

    For an easier upgrade path we provide a compatibility css file that restores the margins prior to this change. To use this file add it to your angular.json:

    "architect": {
  "build": {
    "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
    "options": {
      // ...
      "styles": [
        // ...
        "node_modules/@aposin/ng-aquila/css/compatibility.css",
      ]
    }
  }
}

    For the exact changes please check compatibility.css or

    Expand here to show a summary of the changes
    Component Changes
    expansion-panel/accordion Removed margin-top: 16px before the first expansion-panel inside an accordion.
    button Removed margin: 0 0 24px 0 .
    cards Removed margin-bottom: 24px from the nx-card component and margin-bottom: 8px from the nx-selectable-card component.
    checkbox Removed margin-bottom: 16px .
    copytext Removed margin: 0 0 32px 0 . The copytext now has a default margin: 0 .
    dynamic-table Removed margin: 32px 0 .
    headlines Removed margin-bottom from each headline size. The headlines now have a default margin: 0 .
    lists Removed margin-bottom: 32px from the list and margin-bottom: 16px from the last list item.
    notifications and errors Removed margin: 12px 0 from nx-message , nx-message-banner and nx-error (of type message ). For the Message Toast the margin is still used.
    number-stepper Removed margin-top: 12px if there is no label set.
    pagination Removed margin: 8px 0 from the Advanced Pagination (+ smaller screens: margin: 8px 0 40px 0 ) and margin: 16px 0 from the Simple Pagination (smaller screens: `margin: 40px 0).
    taglist Removed margin-bottom: 32px on the list. On the single tag items, there is still used a margin-bottom .

  • card: Removal of the selecting functionality for the nx-card component in favor of nx-selectable-card

    The deprecated selectable, selected, disabled and selectedChange properties were removed from the nx-card component. Please update to the nx-selectable-card component that covers all this functionality.

  • comparison-table: The deprecated label input of nxComparisonTableRowGroup was removed. Use labelCollapsed instead.

  • datefield:

    • The deprecated format() function was removed, which is not needed to be called anymore.
    • The deprecated getPopupConnectionElementRef() method was removed. Use getConnectedOverlayOrigin() instead.
    • The deprecated calendarHeader property was removed from NxDatepickerIntl. Use switchToMultiYearViewLabel instead.

  • dropdown: The deprecated nxAriaLabel input input was removed. Accessibility for dropdown is now achieved with aria-labelledby that is set automatically.

  • icon-registry: The deprecated getSvgIcon() method was removed. Please use getIcon() instead.

  • margin-classes: corrected nx-margin-x-{size} and nx-margin-y-{size} classes

    Previously when using a nx-margin-x-{size} or nx-margin-y-{size} class, all four margins (top, right, bottom, left) were affected. When using nx-margin-x-{size} classes, the vertical margins are no longer set to 0. When using nx-margin-y-{size} classes, the horizontal margins are no longer set to 0.

  • progress-indicator: The deprecated title input was removed. Use a nx-label element as content to the indicator instead.

  • radio-toggle: Removal of the deprecated selection setter.

  • small-stage: Rewrite to support retail

    • The contentNarrow input of nx-small-stage was renamed to narrow and moved to the nx-small-stage-content directive.
    • The offsetEnd input of nx-small-stage was moved to the nx-small-stage-end-image directive.
    • The inputUrl input of nx-small-stage was renamed to src and moved to the nx-small-stage-end-image directive.
    • The small-stage-image-container-padding-start theming token was renamed to small-stage-image-container-padding-to-content.
    • The small-stage-background-color theming token was removed. Please set the background-color directly with css.

Automatic update (ng update)

We want to make the update as seamless as possible for you with the use of Angular schematics. By using ng update from the Angular CLI this will automatically migrate your project to the new setup. You can update with the following commands:

ng update @angular/cli @angular/core --force
ng update @angular/cdk --force
ng update @aposin/ng-aquila --force

You can use the Angular CLI's --allowDirty flag if you don't want to commit between these steps.
